chunks.en: Rejected from interview, feeling lost as a single, health overdrawn, feeling like I have accomplished nothing
My recent state is really bad, I feel like I'm doing terribly in career, relationship, and health
It's been half a year since I worked. Today I interviewed for technical support at DW. Overall, my experience matches the requirements.
The first interview in the morning went smoothly, and I was notified for the second interview in the afternoon not long after. I was quite excited and felt that the opportunity was great.
But when I got to the second interview, I suddenly got nervous and didn't perform very well, but overall it felt okay, we talked for more than 40 minutes.

After the interview, I was told that I didn't pass, and no specific reason was given. I was really confused at the time. I was really looking forward to this job and felt that I met all the requirements, but they still didn't want me. I feel very sad ğŸ˜¢
Besides work, I'm also quite confused about relationships.

I haven't been in a relationship yet. I didn't have any thoughts on this when I was in school. After graduating, I worked alone in Shanghai, and slowly began to feel lonely. I realized that I also want to find someone to live with.
But I have no idea how to meet suitable people of the opposite sex, or how to start a relationship.
I always feel that my social circle is too small and I can't meet the right people. Over time, I started to feel anxious.
I haven't taken good care of my health either. I already have poor sleep and like to stay up late, and I don't eat properly. I know that many bad habits are not good, but I just can't change them.
I feel that my physical condition has deteriorated in the past few years, and I occasionally worry about it, but I just can't control myself.
The feeling now is that life is so hard, nothing is done well, and nothing goes smoothly.
I'm almost 25 years old, my career hasn't improved, my love life is blank, and even my health is overdrawn. I really don't know how to adjust... I'm a little confused and a little discouraged.
Health is also not a big deal, only 25 years old. Just run and exercise, fly less, and don't go to business class.

When I was 25, I was still working like a dog in the research institute for a degree. I was often asked to go to the gate to pick up express delivery for him, help him move things, etc. I couldn't see any future, I was fat and insecure, I had never been in love, I couldn't even talk to girls, I was poor and ugly, and I was confused about the future. Now at 36, isn't it the same with a wife and children and a warm bed?
Only 25 years old, so young, the main thing is that the current environment is really not good~
We always think we will meet many people in the future, but in fact, there are very few who can really communicate.
Go to more social activities, meet the opposite sex, and only when you have relationship experience, you truly  start living
When you are young, you have the same troubles. After you get through it, you find that there are other troubles.
I can only advise myself not to worry, cherish the moment, seize the opportunity and don't hesitate, don't miss it.
It's too difficult to quit staying up late, and it goes back to the original state after holidays.
Start by managing your physical health.
The body is the container of the spirit, and physical health is also beneficial to mental health.
Exercise, whether it is strength training or aerobic exercise, is the most basic and practical way of self-management.
Self-management and improvement should also start from these seemingly simple but extremely important foundations.
Stick to exercise, eat healthy, and have a regular schedule. A healthy state starts with a healthy lifestyle.
Fitness is also a very certain thing, and investment will definitely pay off.
In comparison, work depends on the market supply and demand and the economic environment, and love also has elements of fate and luck.

These all contain many variables beyond personal control, and the initiative of body management is entirely in one's own hands, which is the most suitable starting point for building self-confidence and a sense of accomplishment.
If you can freely manage your own body, you can extend it to managing your lifestyle, and then gradually to managing your life plan.
OP fighting~
Being rejected for an interview is not necessarily your own problem, maybe there was no position in the first place, just an interview KPI, purely wasting other people's time
Sometimes interviews just depend on fate, there is always a job or relationship that is suitable for you.
No big deal, I found that every boy will be confused at 25 years old, I was also very confused at 25 years old, and as a result, I figured it out at 27.
I had never been in love once before I was 27 years old, after 27 years old I started a different life

Maybe when I was lonely at 25 years old, I also forgot how I persisted at the beginning, but the only thing I can be sure of is that at that time, I kept insisting on good habits, and it had a great impact on the future
Don't deny everything about yourself because of temporary setbacks.
Remember that everything now is just a necessary path to the future.
Aside from anything else, get up early, exercise, and eat regularly.
Except for the fact that there may not be much progress in your career, other things will improve, good luck
Think about when you were born, you were still naked, with nothing.
Start changing from small things, such as: diet, fitness.
The background of most people is still ordinary, and very few people make a splash at the age of 25.
Good luck

chunks.en: Go do more exercise, even if it's just taking a walk in the park. Also, being rejected and having high expectations are very normal phenomena. If you look at life in the long run, there are too many unsatisfactory things. Every stage has its worries. It's better to shorten it and look at the present day, this hour. Have you treated it seriously? Seize the moment and look forward.
Rejected from an interview, easy, if 'I' am not welcome here, there will be other places that will welcome 'I'.

'I' changed to 'I' am single. Someone who has been there says you need to have relationships, otherwise you won't know how to have one when you meet the right person and may miss your health, so pay more attention.
The embarrassment of the person above is hilarious
I wanted to comfort you, but you said you're almost 25, so wouldn't my life be over if I'm like this at 30+? It made me angry.
These little problems are nothing at your age. I think you're just being pretentious and need more social love. Come back and complain after being loved by society for a few more years.

A 25-year-old has an unlimited future. The advice from someone who has been there is that the body is the most important. The further you go, the more you will find that your body gives you a higher bonus. Even if you quarrel in a meeting, the one with the loudest voice is more likely to win, so exercise more.

In terms of relationships, when I was 25, I chased a girl, and then the girl told me that she hoped her other half could help her grow, and I was too naive; in the end, she found someone older than her, and she's doing well. It's easy for girls to find someone if they figure out their goals.

Don't even mention it, when I was 25, in 2019, that was really the most difficult year I've had since I started working. I was so depressed without a job that I couldn't get up. After I got a job, I found that it was a dangerous place, so I was so anxious that I couldn't sleep every day, and I wanted to roll down the stairs of the subway station every day.

What I want to say is that everything is difficult at the beginning. When you accept the status quo, that's it, it won't get worse. Find a goal that you can achieve with a slight leap, then the next one, and then the next one, and slowly get out of it.
Finally, health is very important. You will feel the impact of staying up late in a few years. Now I can't stay up at all.
Almost 24, should be a younger sister born in 2001, relax, don't be too anxious, being rejected for an interview is normal, just treat it as an experience.
The next one will be better.
Think about when I was 24 years old in 2019, I worked and encountered two companies that were disbanded after working for half a year. It was really uncomfortable at that time.
Later I went out to play for a while, changed my mood, and came back to continue looking for a job, and I got through it.
Now I'm 30, and I found that the things I'm anxious about are still those things, so it's okay~
You are another me. Fellow peers, good luck, things will get better
